disp-quote.p: “ When I first started PrEP it was difficult, but I never lost hope. […] It’s very scary to have unprotected sex with an HIV-positive person. Even my HIV-positive wife was so afraid asking how we can have sex without using condoms. […] Then I took her to the clinic so that she could understand better from the health workers, she accepted the idea of me taking PrEP. She was afraid that she will get me infected with HIV because she does not want me to get infected by HIV since I have many wives and I will spread the infection to them. ”–Male, 43, in SDC (RUR18) (AAM)
